Claim: "A man in a white shirt speaks into a microphone."
Implication: "A man in a white shirt is making a speech in front of a crowd."
Referring expressions: A man, white shirt, microphone.  A man in a white shirt, crowd
Formula: (exists a (IsInWhiteShirt(a) and SpeaksIntoMicrophone(a)) & (forall f (forall g ( IsInWhiteShirt(f) ->  IsMakingASpeech(g)))) & (forall i (forall h ( IsMakingASpeech(h) ->  IsInWhiteShirt(i)))) & (forall j (forall k (  SpeaksIntoMicrophone(j) ->  IsMakingASpeech(k)))) & (forall l (forall m ( IsMakingASpeech(l) ->   SpeaksIntoMicrophone(m))))) -> (exists e (exists d (IsMakingASpeech(d) and IsInFrontOfCrowd(e))))
